artist: Kitagawa Utamaro Published by Yamaguchiya Chūsuke
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text:
The game played here is <I>kazu-ken<I>, a numbers game that originated in China, and is played with the right hand making numbers from zero to five. At the same time the opponents call out the combined number likely to result, and the loser had to drink a cup of sake.

The three people are the leading characters of the kabuki play "Sukeroku's Affinity for Edo Cherry Blossoms (<I>Sukeroku yukari no Edo zakura<I>)" about the love affair between the courtesan Agemaki and the dashing dandy Sukeroku who is playing with his rival Ikyu_.
title: The Courtesan Agemaki, the Ruffian Hero Sukeroku, and Hige no Ikyū
